chapter.title: Running the Workflow
chapter.para:
The @@ProductName@@ comes with onethree pre-defined, troubleshooting workflow: FTTx Connectivity & Quality Validation Workflow.

Frequently interrupted Broadband Connection

section.title: FTTx Connectivity & Quality Validation Workflow
section.para:
This workflow handles the following:
Fiber connectivity issues
ONT is not on
Degraded optical quality
When started by a CSR, the workflow performs tests to get information about the service impact to the customer, as shown in the following diagram Basic FTTx Validation Workflow decision paths

step.para: Click the Workflows tab and select the appropriate workflow in the left panel.
Wait for the workflow to launch actions.
After the first set of actions completes, the buttons appear on the right:

Click Continue to proceed to the next set of tests and actions, or click Cancel as appropriate. After you move to the second step in the workflow, a Back button becomes available to repeat the previous set of tests and actions,
A "breadcrumb path" is displayed below the title bar, showing the workflow steps that have been executed so far.

When service is down, you can continue after the above results page; continuing causes the system to escalate the problem either to a file or to a new or existing work order.xxx Add more detail re: escalating to a work order when can view this. When you escalate an issue, the system displays the escalation information in the console.
When you reach the end of the workflow, you may restart it by clicking the Restart Workflow button, or view the detailed results.
The results of the workflow tests and actions are available in the Account Activity tab.

tip.para: The actions or tests that have been run by a workflow, and the workflow itself, are marked in the Account Activity Sessions list with a _WF suffix.

step.para: When the workflow is over, you may also be prompted to launch another diagnostic, or to escalate the ticket to Level 2 support. If this happens, open the Diagnostics tab and select the appropriate action(s).

section.title: Slow Broadband Connection Workflow
section.para: This workflow provides for scenarios where the subscriber complains that the broadband connection is slow. The workflow addresses common DSL issues that can cause a unstable or degraded DSL performance resulting in slow data throughput at the application layer.

Typical workflow content:
Determine if the DSL QoS is acceptable
Determine if there DSL line is currently is not synchronization (If yes, go to “No Broadband Connection” workflow)
Determine if there has been frequent loss of DSL synchronization (If yes, go to “Frequently Interrupted Broadband Connection” workflow)
Check for profile or service template mismatches
Troubleshoot degraded DSL performance using LSD results
Troubleshoot degraded DSL performance using LQD
Escalate unresolved degraded DSL performance to Level-2 support
Notify subscriber of results

section.title: Frequently interrupted Broadband Connection Workflow
section.para: This workflow provides for scenarios where the subscriber complains that the broadband connectivity is intermittent. The workflow addresses common DSL issues that can cause an unstable DSL connection.

Typical workflow content:
Determine if there has been frequent loss of DSL synchronization
Determine if the DSL QoS is acceptable
Determine if there DSL line is currently is not synchronization (If yes, go to “No Broadband Connection” workflow)
Check for profile or service template mismatches
Troubleshoot unstable DSL synchronization using LSD results
Troubleshoot unstable DSL synchronization using LQD
Escalate unresolved sync failures to Level-2 support
Notify subscriber of results

section.title: No Broadband Connection Workflow
section.para: This workflow provides for scenarios where the subscriber complains that there is no broadband connectivity. The workflow addresses common DSL issues that can cause No Broadband Connection error.

Typical workflow content:
Determine if there is DSL synchronization
Determine if the DSL QoS is acceptable
Troubleshoot no DSL sync using SELT
Request subscriber to confirm CPE is connected & powered on: Are LEDs on?
Run SELT: Is CPE connected? Is CPE turned on?
Check for profile or service template mismatches
Troubleshoot sync failures using LQD (with reinit)
Escalate unresolved sync failures to Level-2 support
Notify subscriber of results
